item.title: Base Conversions in PHP
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

I did this little project a while back for Kloplop, I think.

http://junk.sneamia.net/base_conversion/?n=27&k=4

n takes the number in base 10. k takes the final base number. In the example above, it takes the number 27, and converts it to base 4.

if (($_GET['n'] >= 0) && ($_GET['k'] >= 2)) { for ($i = 0; pow($_GET['k'], $i) <= $_GET['n']; $i++) {} $i--; $n = $_GET['n']; while ($i >= 0) { $exp = pow($_GET['k'], $i); $digit = floor($n / $exp); $n -= $exp * $digit; $i--; $result = $result * 10 + $digit; } echo $_GET['n'], ' in base ', $_GET['k'], ' is ', $result; }

It should output “27 in base 4 is 123.”
